storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve accurate and timely schedule updates

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change submission with valid data
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
Test attachment file (PDF/DOC, under 10MB) is prepared

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields including date, time, reason, and attachment upload option

steps.action: Enter valid schedule change date (future date in format MM/DD/YYYY)
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid schedule change time (in format HH:MM AM/PM)
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid reason for schedule change in the reason field (minimum 10 characters)
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Click on attachment upload button and select a valid document file (PDF, 5MB)
steps.expectedResult: File is uploaded successfully and file name is displayed in the attachment section

steps.action: Review all entered data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All fields display the entered data correctly with no validation error messages

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Request is accepted and processed within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the confirmation message displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message is displayed with a unique request ID in the format SCR-XXXXXX

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Request status is set to 'Submitted'
Unique request ID is generated and associated with the request
User remains on confirmation page or is redirected to request list

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked with asterisk (*)

steps.action: Leave the date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the time field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without pre-filled data

steps.action: Click outside the mandatory fields to trigger real-time validation
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights missing fields with red border and displays inline error messages such as 'Date is required', 'Time is required', 'Reason is required'

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and Submit button either remains disabled or prevents form submission

steps.action: Verify error messages displayed at the top of the form or near each field
steps.expectedResult: Clear error messages are displayed indicating which mandatory fields are missing: 'Please complete all required fields before submitting'

steps.action: Fill in only the date field with valid data and attempt to submit again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is still blocked with error messages for remaining mandatory fields (time and reason)

postconditions: No record is created in ScheduleChangeRequests table
User remains on the submission form page
All validation error messages are visible to the user
Form data is retained for user to complete

testCases.title: Ensure duplicate schedule change requests are prevented
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change submission page is accessible
Database is accessible for verification
No existing schedule change request exists for the test schedule and time period

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: Submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields

steps.action: Enter schedule change date as '12/15/2024'
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input

steps.action: Enter schedule change time as '10:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts the input

steps.action: Enter reason as 'Equipment maintenance required'
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the input

steps.action: Click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Request is accepted and confirmation message with unique request ID (e.g., SCR-001234) is displayed

steps.action: Note the request ID and navigate back to schedule change submission page
steps.expectedResult: New blank submission form is displayed

steps.action: Enter the same schedule change date as '12/15/2024'
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input

steps.action: Enter the same schedule change time as '10:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts the input

steps.action: Enter reason as 'Additional maintenance work'
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the input

steps.action: Click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the duplicate request and displays error message: 'A schedule change request already exists for this schedule and time period. Request ID: SCR-001234'

steps.action: Access the database and query ScheduleChangeRequests table for schedule date '12/15/2024' and time '10:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns only one record with request ID SCR-001234

steps.action: Verify the count of records for the specific schedule and time combination
steps.expectedResult: Count equals 1, confirming only a single unique request exists

postconditions: Only one schedule change request exists in the database for the specified schedule and time
Duplicate request was not saved to the database
User is informed of the existing request with its ID
Data integrity is maintained in ScheduleChangeRequests table

storyTitle: As Schedule Coordinator, I want to save schedule change requests as drafts to achieve flexibility in submission

testCases.title: Validate saving and retrieving schedule change drafts
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to create and save drafts
Schedule change request form is accessible
ScheduleChangeDrafts table is accessible and empty for this user

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request form page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields empty and Save Draft button is visible

steps.action: Enter partial data: schedule change date as '01/20/2025'
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts and displays the entered value

steps.action: Enter partial data: schedule change time as '02:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts and displays the entered value

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty (mandatory field intentionally left blank)
steps.expectedResult: Reason field remains empty without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Save Draft button
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved within 2 seconds and confirmation message is displayed: 'Draft saved successfully' with timestamp

steps.action: Navigate away from the form page to dashboard or another page
steps.expectedResult: User is navigated to the selected page without data loss warning

steps.action: Navigate back to schedule change request form or access 'My Drafts' section
steps.expectedResult: List of saved drafts is displayed showing the recently saved draft with date/time information

steps.action: Click on the saved draft to retrieve and edit it
steps.expectedResult: Draft is loaded within 2 seconds and form is displayed

steps.action: Verify the date field contains the previously entered value '01/20/2025'
steps.expectedResult: Date field is pre-filled with '01/20/2025'

steps.action: Verify the time field contains the previously entered value '02:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Time field is pre-filled with '02:00 PM'

steps.action: Verify the reason field is empty as it was not filled during draft save
steps.expectedResult: Reason field is empty, confirming draft data is loaded correctly

postconditions: Draft is saved in ScheduleChangeDrafts table with user association
Draft data is accurately retrieved and pre-filled in the form
User can continue editing the draft
Draft remains in saved state until submitted or deleted

testCases.title: Verify validation is bypassed on draft save
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to create and save drafts
Schedule change request form is accessible
User understands mandatory field requirements for final submission

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request form page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked with asterisk (*)

steps.action: Leave all mandatory fields empty (date, time, reason)
steps.expectedResult: All fields remain empty

steps.action: Click the Save Draft button without filling any mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully within 2 seconds without any validation errors or warnings

steps.action: Verify confirmation message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message 'Draft saved successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Retrieve the saved draft from 'My Drafts' section
steps.expectedResult: Draft is loaded with all fields empty as saved

steps.action: Without filling any mandatory fields, click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked immediately

steps.action: Verify validation error messages are displayed
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors are displayed for all missing mandatory fields: 'Date is required', 'Time is required', 'Reason is required'

steps.action: Fill in only the date field with '02/10/2025' and attempt to submit again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is still blocked with validation errors for time and reason fields

steps.action: Click Save Draft button with only date field filled
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully without validation errors, confirming validation is bypassed on draft save

postconditions: Draft with partial/missing data is saved in ScheduleChangeDrafts table
Validation rules are enforced only on final submission attempt
User can save incomplete drafts multiple times without validation blocking
Draft remains editable until final submission

testCases.title: Ensure auto-save triggers every 2 minutes
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Coordinator
User has necessary permissions to create drafts
Schedule change request form is accessible
Auto-save functionality is enabled in system settings
Timer or clock is available to track 2-minute intervals

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request form page and note the current time
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all fields empty and current time is recorded (e.g., 10:00:00 AM)

steps.action: Enter schedule change date as '03/15/2025'
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts and displays the entered value

steps.action: Wait for 2 minutes without any user interaction (do not click Save Draft or Submit)
steps.expectedResult: After exactly 2 minutes (at 10:02:00 AM), auto-save triggers automatically

steps.action: Observe for auto-save notification or indicator on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Auto-save notification is displayed: 'Draft auto-saved at [timestamp]' or auto-save indicator shows successful save

steps.action: Enter additional data: schedule change time as '03:30 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts and displays the entered value

steps.action: Wait for another 2 minutes without any user interaction
steps.expectedResult: After 2 minutes (at 10:04:00 AM), auto-save triggers again automatically

steps.action: Observe for second auto-save notification
steps.expectedResult: Auto-save notification is displayed with updated timestamp confirming second auto-save

steps.action: Navigate away from the form without manually saving
steps.expectedResult: User can navigate away, and data is preserved due to auto-save

steps.action: Return to the form or access 'My Drafts' section
steps.expectedResult: Draft is available in the drafts list

steps.action: Open the auto-saved draft and verify the data
steps.expectedResult: Draft contains the latest entered data: date '03/15/2025' and time '03:30 PM', confirming auto-save persisted the data correctly

steps.action: Check the draft timestamp in the database or UI
steps.expectedResult: Draft timestamp matches the last auto-save time (approximately 10:04:00 AM)

postconditions: Draft is auto-saved in ScheduleChangeDrafts table every 2 minutes
Latest entered data is persisted without manual save action
Auto-save functionality operates independently of user actions
User can recover work even if they navigate away without manual save
